definition: quick decision
fast/rapid/quick/velocity
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly

sentences.english: The quick, decisive victory that Napoleon expected never happened.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑期盼着的速决速胜迟迟没有发生。

sentences.english: She had a strong will and power of rapid decision.
sentences.chinese: 她具有坚强的意志和速决的才能。

sentences.english: Women love quickies as much as men do.
sentences.chinese: 女人和男人一样喜欢速战速决。

sentences.english: So the sword male plan to kill the villagers, to ensure a quick victory of the war.
sentences.chinese: 于是剑雄打算杀了那些村名，以保证战争速战速决。

sentences.english: Being an aggressive baseliner, he is also known for finishing off his opponents quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位底线攻击型球员，以速战速决著称。

sentences.english: If we want to win the war, we have to combine quickly decided battles with lasting confrontations.
sentences.chinese: 要想打赢这场战争，就要把速决战和持久战结合起来。

definition: a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)
rapid victory
(to do sth) with dispatch/as soon as possible
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
guidelines/what to do (under given circumstances)
to accomplish the whole task at one stroke (idiom)
pinyin: bi4 qi2 gong1 yu2 yi1 yi4

definition: the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to delay/to postpone
confidential aspects of a matter/secrets/key moment for action
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
cannot/to not be able (to)/to be unable to
to advance prematurely
to set a date/to set a time frame/within a certain time limit
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
